metadata.title: CVE-2017-5072 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation in Omnibox in Google Chrome prior to59.0.3071.92 for Android allowed a remote attacker to perform domainspoofing with RTL characters via a crafted URL page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5072` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360').
